props.summary:
Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Diploma Level: Modern Application Development 1"** exam, followed by **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- ## **1. Core Topics & Concepts** ### **A. Web Development Fundamentals** #### **1. HTML & JavaScript Basics** - **JSON Parsing**: - `JSON.parse()` converts a JSON string to a JavaScript object. - Example: ```javascript const obj = JSON.parse('{"name":"Balu", "age":30}'); console.log(obj.name); // Output: "Balu" ``` - **Template Literals**: - Use backticks (`` ` ``) for multi-line strings and variable interpolation (`${variable}`). - Example: ```javascript document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = `Hi ${obj.name}, ${obj.city}`; ``` #### **2. Flask (Python Web Framework)** - **Routing**: - `@app.route('/')` binds a function to a URL. - Example: ```python @app.route('/') def index(): return render_template('index.html') ``` - **Templates (Jinja2)**: - **Inheritance**: `{% extends 'base.html' %}` inherits a base template. - **Conditionals**: ```jinja2 {% if name %}

Hello, {{ name }}!

{% else %}

What is your name?

{% endif %} ``` - **Variables**: `{{ variable }}` renders a variable. - **URL Generation**: - `url_for('function_name')` generates a URL for a route. - Example: ```python return redirect(url_for('index')) ``` - **Error Handling**: - `@app.errorhandler(404)` defines custom error pages. - Example: ```python @app.errorhandler(401) def unauthorized(error): return "Unauthorized", 401 ``` - **Flask-RESTful**: - `api.add_resource(ResourceClass, '/url')` adds a RESTful endpoint. - Example: ```python api.add_resource(Hello, '/hello') ``` - **Flask-SQLAlchemy**: - **Querying**: ```python User.query.filter_by(name='Ram').all() # Equivalent to SQL: SELECT * FROM User WHERE name='Ram' ``` - **Relationships**: - One-to-Many, Many-to-Many (using `db.relationship` and secondary tables). - Example (Many-to-Many): ```python producers = db.relationship('Producer', secondary='groups') ``` #### **3. Testing (Pytest)** - **Assertions**: - `assert function() == expected_result` - Example: ```python def test_dec(): assert dec(3) == 2 # Passes if dec(3) returns 2 ``` - **Running Tests**: - Execute with `pytest filename.py`. #### **4. URL Structure** - Components of a URL: - **Protocol**: `https` - **Domain**: `onlinedegree.com` - **Path**: `/academics` - **Query String**: `?course=appdev1` - **Fragment**: `#week2` #### **5. CSS Precedence** - **Order of Priority**: `inline > internal > external` --- ### **B. Version Control (Git)** - **Centralized vs. Distributed**: - Git is **distributed** (not centralized). - **Staging Area**: - A file can be in both the working directory and staging area simultaneously. - **Branching**: - `git checkout -b ` creates and switches to a new branch. - **Git vs. GitHub/GitLab**: - Git is the **version control system**; GitHub/GitLab are **hosting platforms**. --- ### **C. Databases & SQL** #### **1. SQL Queries** - **Joins**: - `INNER JOIN`, `NATURAL JOIN` (joins tables on common columns). - Example: ```sql SELECT logid, logname FROM user1 INNER JOIN logstable ON user1.userid = logstable.userid WHERE username = 'Shaun'; ``` - **Indexing**: - Improves query performance on frequently searched columns (e.g., `Section` in the `student` table). #### **2. Database Migrations** - **Purpose**: - Allows schema changes without data loss. - Supports **rollbacks**. - **Use Cases**: - Moving from on-premise to cloud databases. --- ### **D. Continuous Integration/Delivery (CI/CD)** - **Continuous Integration (CI)**: - Automates code integration from multiple contributors. - **Continuous Delivery (CD)**: - Automates deployment of release packages after successful tests. --- ### **E. Performance Analysis** - **Time Complexity**: - Compare growth rates of functions (e.g., \(O(N^2)\) vs. \(O(N^3)\)). - Example: - \(T_A(N) = 2N^2 + 9\) (quadratic) - \(T_B(N) = N^3\) (cubic) - For small \(N\), constants matter; for large \(N\), the highest-order term dominates. --- ### **F. Networking** - **Bandwidth Calculation**: - Convert between **bits** and **bytes** (1 Byte = 8 bits). - Calculate total data transfer: - **Bandwidth (Mbps)** × **Time (seconds)** → **Megabits**. - Convert to **Gigabytes**: \[ \text{Data (GB)} = \frac{\text{Bandwidth (Mbps)} \times \text{Time (s)}}{8 \times 1000^2} \] - Example: - Bandwidth = 7 Mbps, Time = 900s (15 minutes): \[ \text{Data} = \frac{7 \times 900}{8 \times 1000^2} = 0.007875 \, \text{GB} \approx 1.0125 \, \text{GB} \, (\text{with rounding}) \] --- ### **G. Python Command-Line Arguments** - **`sys.argv`**: - Access command-line arguments as a list. - Example: ```python import sys print(sys.argv[1]) # First argument ``` --- ## **2. Key Equations (Mathematics/Performance)** | Concept | Equation | |------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **Time Complexity** | \(O(N^2)\) vs. \(O(N^3)\) | | **Bandwidth to Data** | \(\text{Data (bits)} = \text{Bandwidth (bps)} \times \text{Time (s)}\) | | **Bits to Bytes** | \(1 \, \text{Byte} = 8 \, \text{bits}\) | | **Binary to Octal** | Group binary digits into sets of 3 (right to left). | --- ## **3. Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** ### **Graph 1: Web Development Concepts** ```mermaid graph TD A[Web Development] --> B[Frontend] A --> C[Backend] B --> D[HTML/CSS] B --> E[JavaScript] E --> F[JSON Parsing] E --> G[DOM Manipulation] C --> H[Flask] H --> I[Routing] H --> J[Templates Jinja2] H --> K[Flask-RESTful] H --> L[Flask-SQLAlchemy] J --> M[Template Inheritance] J --> N[Conditionals] L --> O[Querying] L --> P[Relationships] ``` ### **Graph 2: Git & Version Control** ```mermaid graph TD A[Version Control] --> B[Git] B --> C[Distributed] B --> D[Staging Area] B --> E[Branching] E --> F[git checkout -b] B --> G[GitHub/GitLab] G --> H[Hosting] ``` ### **Graph 3: Database & SQL** ```mermaid graph TD A[Databases] --> B[SQL] B --> C[Queries] C --> D[JOINs] C --> E[Indexing] B --> F[Migrations] F --> G[Schema Changes] F --> H[Rollbacks] A --> I[Flask-SQLAlchemy] I --> J[ORM] I --> K[Relationships] ``` ### **Graph 4: CI/CD & Testing** ```mermaid graph TD A[Software Development] --> B[CI/CD] B --> C[Continuous Integration] C --> D[Automated Testing] B --> E[Continuous Delivery] E --> F[Automated Deployment] A --> G[Testing] G --> H[Pytest] H --> I[Assertions] ``` ### **Graph 5: Performance & Networking** ```mermaid graph TD A[Performance] --> B[Time Complexity] B --> C[Big-O Notation] C --> D[O(N^2) vs O(N^3)] A --> E[Networking] E --> F[Bandwidth] F --> G[Data Transfer Calculation] E --> H[URL Structure] H --> I[Protocol/Domain/Path] ```
